classes.description: Specifies if attunement to the magic item is restricted to certain classes (or any spellcasters)

description.example:
This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of [[[general:Equipment#tools|artisan's tool]]] of your choice. Whatever form the tool takes, you are proficient with it.

While holding this tool, you gain a bonus to the spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your artificer spells. The bonus is determined by the tool's rarity.

As an action, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

dnd_spell_list.description: An array of all spells in the requested spell list. Use to query /spell/<name> for the spell details.

get.summary: Returns a spell list for a given class

parameters.name: spell_class
parameters.description: The class for which to retrieve the spell list

404.description: The given spell list couldn't be found.

schema.example: "Ligma" is not a valid spell list.

get.summary: Returns a spell list for a given class, for a given spell level

parameters.name: spell_class
parameters.description: The class for which to retrieve the spell list

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The spell level to retrieve the spell list for

404.description: The given spell list couldn't be found.

schema.example: "69" is not a valid spell level.

get.summary: Returns the details for a given spell.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Spell name, case insensitive. Supports full spell titles (e.g. Abi Dalzim's Horrid Wilting) or spell IDs (e.g. abi-dalzims-horrid-wilting)

404.description: The given spell couldn't be found.

schema.example: I couldn't find a spell by the name of "ur mom".

get.summary: Returns a list of magic items for 5e D&D, with filtering options

parameters.name: rarity
parameters.description: The magic item rarity to filter for. Omit to allow all rarities.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The magic item type to filter for. Omit to allow all types.

parameters.name: minor-major
parameters.description: Filters for Minor or Major magic items. Omit to allow both.

parameters.name: attunement
parameters.description: Filters for magic items that do or do not require attunement. Omit to allow all.

parameters.name: subtype
parameters.description:
Filter for magic items that have a subtype defined. For example, the Javelin of Lightning has the type 'weapon' as well as the subtype 'javelin'. Omit to allow all.

Subtype is not restricted to a particular list of allows values, and new subtypes can be defined on an item-by-item basis. Use the /dnd/magic_items/subtypes endpoint to get a list of all currently defined subtypes. Use 'no-subtype' to return magic items without a defined subtype.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Filters for magic items that have class restrictions. Use 'no-restrictions' to allow items that have no class restrictions. Omit to allow all.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Filters for magic items based on the sourcebook they were published in. Case-insensitive and supports partial matches. Omit to allow all.

200.description: A list of all magic items matching the given filter parameters.

get.summary: Returns all currently available magic item subtypes, for use with /dnd/magic-items

200.description: List of all currently available magic item subtypes

example: any sword that deals slashing damage
medium or heavy, but not hide

get.summary: Returns the details for a given magic item.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Magic item name, case insensitive. Supports full titles (e.g. All-Purpose Tool, +1) or IDs (e.g. all-purpose-tool-1)

404.description: The given magic item couldn't be found.

schema.example: I couldn't find a magic item by the name of "Bigby's Vibrating Beads".
